column4: Anybody having troubles with PAE kernel 2.6.38.-11 on Natty? I get a black screen. Even on single user it won't boot.
And what happens with a normal kernel?
I'm on 2.6.38 default. I have 8GB ram. I thought I might try the latest available in USC and it's .11.
I would try moving to the 2.6.38 pae first, before trying moving to the latest avaiable.  One variable at a time, ya know?
normal kernel boots fine. I just need a PAE coz my 5 something GB of RAM Is useless.
makes sense.it's still DLing now. I'm asking if anybody got same probs :)
4gb.  Windows only uses 3 or 3.5 with 32bit, Linux uses 4 :)
KNow the feeling.  Good luck.
for some reason I only get 3.1 even on Linux. my desktop has 4GB and it's the same thing.
Odd.  Maybe your bios/chipset is using some.  Starting back in the early athalon days I think bioses & chipsets started gobbling up ram for their own uses.
yeah it's just 3186MB or roughly 3.2. It's being rounded to 3.1 on System Monitor, but `free` tells the true story.

do you know if anything higher than 2.6.38-8 fixes that regression Phoronix was talking about regarding kernel consuming more power? coz on desktop it's fine. but this here on my laptop i need to save as much power.
I hadn't read that one.
Gonna go search it out, sounds interesting.
you do that. the current Natty kernel accdg. to Phoronix gobbles up more power than the default Meerkat kernel.
IIRC by about 30%
Wow.  And I thought my netbook's battery was just going a little south bout when 11 came out.
...of course that was the excuse to buy a shiny new laptop.
IDK what the official kernel devs said about the claims by Phoronix but they had a really good story. Even 3.0 still hast that power hungry bug.
lol.... great excuse :P
My head's been deep in other efforts latey, but this does remind me to start reading phronix and other linux sites more regularly...
